column1: ## Table (tab-separated) of DADA2 nifH pipeline outputs for all nifH amplicon studies.
##   * The first column names the study.
##   * The second column is the path to the ASV FASTA file.  The corresponding ASV abundance table
##     must be in the same directory as the FASTA. (The pipeline puts both in TextData.)  The path
##     may be absolute, or relative to the directory of the GatherAsvs Makefile.
##   * The third column is a tag which must be distinct for every row. The tags become the sample
##     (column) names in the final abundance table output by GatherAsv.  Tags may be structured
##     if you like.  Here they are structured as:
##     with processingGroupNum an integer that enables tags to be distinct within a study.  The SRA
##     study is no_SRA if the data set is not in the SRA.
## For legibility the rows are grouped by study.  Each study had its own run of the pipeline.
## Within each study the rows are separate "processing groups" (separate runs of DADA2 within one
## run of the pipeline).  The processing groups are reflected by the components in the directory
## structure.  For example BentzonTilia_2015 has 4 processing groups: {RoskildeFjor, GreatBelt} X
## {RNA, DNA}, which were defined by the columns in
## Shiozaki_2017 - Mixed-orientation sequencing library. Combined ASVs from normal and swapped primer runs of the pipeline
## Shiozaki_2018GBC - Mixed-orientation sequencing library. Combined ASVs from normal and swapped primer runs of the pipeline
